intro: Hibbertia spanantha, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. Hibbertia spanantha produces small, oval-shaped leaves and is often found in open habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
